page.title: 09Life in the Eighties
page.content: In the eighties one of societies biggest problems was brought to light,soccer violence.This year alone there were horrific scenes at the Luton v Millwall cup tie,violence in which a wall collapsed and killed a 15 year old boy. There was the tradedy of the European Cup Final between Liverpool and Juventus when 48 died because a wall collapsed at the Hienzel Stadium in Brussels.For FIFA this was the last straw and they promptly banned English clubs from playing in Europe indefinitely. On the bright side there was NASAs space shuttle,the first reusable space vehicle,it proved a great success until it muffed a few satellite launches.Sir Clive Sinclair had a massive success with the ZX SPECTRUM computer.
